adjective.description: (of a word or form) denoting or referring to just one person or thing.

examples: the singular beauty of the desert

adjective.description: (of a square matrix) having a zero determinant.
Denoting a point that is a singularity.

noun.description: The singular form of a word.

origin: Middle English (in the sense solitary, single, also beyond the average): from Old French singuler, from Latin singularis, from singulus (see single).
